dialogues.speaker: DISTANT GUN AND MORTAR FIRE
dialogues.text: Muffled by the wet green forest. The very earth seems to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: A RABBIT
dialogues.text: Darts out of a log, lifts itself on its hind legs and sni the air.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBED GRENADE EXPLODES
dialogues.text: VOICES and SHOUTS, closer now, mix with the rumbling WAR  SOUNDS in a veritable symphony of violence and confusion. A DEAD AMERICAN GI lays splayed out, careless in death. A pair of SOLDIERS flash among the trees, running hunched over and low, and disappear into the gray blooms of SMOKE For a moment the forest takes a breath. Nothing but trembling leaves. Then - The RATTLE of a Jeep Coming closer in fits and starts, GRINDING through low ge A Willys MB appears, CRASHING through the undergrowth. It's driven by Private First Class KELLY ERNSWILER. Eighteen, if that. Not much meat on him. His insignias  indicate he's in the 29th Infantry. His face might be attractive, under other conditions. He pauses and pulls a map from the pocket of his M41 stan issue field jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are those Krauts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To give himself courage, he SINGS Tommy Dorsey's "I'll Be Seeing You [in all the old familiar places]" while maneuv the Jeep through the bushes and rocks. He drives straight for a fallen LOG, GUNS the engine and  tries to go over it. The Jeep's FRONT WHEELS catch on the log. The BACK TIRES spin. Kelly gets out. Takes off his M1 combat helmet and wipes face. Assesses the situation. He grabs a BRANCH. Jams it under the wheel, trying to lev the Jeep free. When -- The STUTTER of a nearby MACHINE GUN startles him. The branch SNAPS against Kelly's weight. He slips and fal in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Determined, he grabs his pack and carbine and sets off on foot through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly strides purposefully out of the woods. Pauses again a split-rail fence beneath the innocent sun. Across the clearing stands a seemingly abandoned BARN. But not for long, as TWO GERMAN INFANTRYMEN appear around the corner of it. Kelly moves behind a tree to assess the situation. Unaware, the Germans smoke and talk. Kelly's too far away hear them but he watches their every move. They're relaxed, not as on guard as they should be. Their Karabiners rest slung across their backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: AGAINST THE TREE
dialogues.text: Kelly focuses himself. Then he shoulders his carbine. Pulls out his dog tags and kisses them grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And so they buried Hector, breaker  of horses."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his Smith & Wesson 1917 PISTOL from his pist and steps out into the SUNLIGHT FIELD in plain sight of t guards. Surely he knows they can see him. He must want them to se him. But they don't. Too busy passing nudie wallet photos. Halfway across the open grass, Kelly raises the pistol bu does not aim it. Just strides steadily closer, arms spread out, making him an easy target. Crazy as it seems, Private Kelly Ernswiler is trying to g himself killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly pauses not twenty feet from the Germans, FIRES into the air and waves -- -- when from behind him comes a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eine maus findet den kase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly whips around to face a third German, the OFFICER. His pistol points right into the Officer's shocked pink y face. Point blank range. Only - Kelly doesn't fire. He just lowers the pistol. The German smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me Adolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mien Prisoner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Infantrymen have recovered from their idle and come  running. One of them yanks Kelly's hands behind his back and pushe him into the barn roughly. Kelly doesn't struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Siegfreid and Roy. What are you  waiting for? Kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sits slumped in a chair, legs tied up. One of the  Germans shines a flashlight in his face. Kelly squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on you pussies. Let's get this  over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The German Officer produces a piece of paper and a founta pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German accent) You will write your mother. Tell her  how you will die now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly takes the pen and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genuine Third Reich issue, no less.  Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer pokes the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will write. How you die alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother and I don't have that kind  of relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses) Write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly thinks about it for a minute - should he or shouldn he - but sighs and begins writing. After a few lines, the Officer snatches the paper away and passes it to an  Infantryman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. Now you will beg for your  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What don't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts sheepishly  in German accent) The protocol says we should -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer wheels around and scowls at the speaker. He s to be getting a bit hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the fucking protocol. (to Kelly) Beg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Kelly glare at each other. The Officer FIRES his Luger into the rafters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg - for - your - life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer grabs his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Now I have a little fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly laughs. The officer slaps him. Kelly jerks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's against the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sneers) There are no rules in war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly another AMERICAN GI appears behind the German in the shadows. Only Kelly can see him. The GI motions to Kelly "keep tal while he gets into a better position with his M-1 rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Officer) You've never killed anyone before,  have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shower in the blood of my victims --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GI shoots the two infantrymen who fall in exaggerated pain and commence death throes. Quick as a flash, the GI's Colt 1911 PISTOL is at the Ger Officer's neck, his M-1 in his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder you smell so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GI's eyes widen. He looks at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you look at the manners on this  guy? (to German) Remember to thank me when I kill  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really, not in the neck -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the GI does anyway. The Officer SHRIEKS, grabs at his neck, and falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. My elaborate death scene wasn't  going anywhere anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to give you a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. They'll get me  eventually. If you can't get killed  in a war, when can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Look on the bright  side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GI holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart. Bart Bowland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly takes the hand of the grinning all-American type gu About his own age, but BART takes up more space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly. Kelly Ernswiler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimics) Bart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean - that's Irish, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the floor, now  with a decidedly  American accent) Wow man, this is a really beautiful  scene and all, but I have to  interrupt. (to Bart) Why the fuck did you have to shoot  that cap so close to my neck? You  gave me a powder burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen you wienerschnitzel. You should  talk. You slapped me. I'm not your  bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer gets up and dusts off his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what was that whole creepy  death wish thing about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it didn't work, now did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Sometimes I get so caught up in the  moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what was that ridiculous shit  about making me write to my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspired, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you made him write to his  mother? Who are you, Dr. Phil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also with American  accent) Can we get up now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart helps him up and checks his regulation-issue Timex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well. There's only an hour  left anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The German Officer crosses his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) Admit it. You were scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorts) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gets up from the chair and falls over. His legs are still tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEAD GI gets up and walks off with the GERMANS and so other SOLDIERS, done for the day. Bart and Kelly walk back to the stranded Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Willys yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. Just got her. Three summers  packing out at Shop Rite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart unfolds an entrenching tool from his belt and digs u the back wheels, building up dirt. Then he goes around to the front and puts his shoulder ag the hood. Bart rocks the Jeep while Kelly pumps the gas. The Jeep finally pulls free and SPRAYS Bart with mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bad. Thanks though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks over his shoulder and starts backing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart stands there, dripping with mud, shocked. About a hundred feet away Kelly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart walks towards the Jeep. Kelly backs it up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real funny, Ernswiler. You might  still get your chance to die today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customers are all REENACTORS. Some Yanks, some German a few Scottish and North African irregulars. "Boogie-Woog Bugle Boy" plays on the jukebox. Bart and Kelly sit in a booth together. Bart has an easy, confident manner and expansive gestures. Kelly eats hunch over, like someone might try and steal his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Character building? Those crazy guys  from Ann Arbor tied them to a dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) That's what you get for invading  Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D-Day at Kenosha was nothing. At  Guadalcanal Chillicothe there was a  guy who actually injected himself  with malaria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both eat for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you live, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaker Heights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That explains the death wish. Me  too. What street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penn Place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing) Hmm, don't know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not technically in Shaker Heights  - but I go to Shaker Heights High.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Kelly looks at Bart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Langely Prep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got kicked out of Shaker  Heights High because my birdhouse  came unglued in honors woodshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I would have gone to  Langely myself only my polo pony had  the fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart throws his napkin on his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter. (raises his voice to  address the room) We're all soldiers here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right./Here, here./ Whooping,  cheers, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly pulls up into the circular gravel drive. Bart's hou is fancy. A nice yard and a pool. Bart hops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come over some time. Service our lawnmower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would, but then I might soil my  croquet whites. You understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bourgeois. Cheerio then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly watches Bart go into his house and smiles in spite himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's house is a also pretty nice, nothing to be ashame of. It is smaller and weirder. The flowers and bushes are overgrown and strange sculptures dot the yard, some leani at precarious angles. Kelly washes his Jeep in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly buffs the headlamps with a chamois. The Jeep looks  good as new. He pulls a canvas cover over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep tight Hot Lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly walks in on his dad ABE making sandwiches. A great pile of cheese and PB&J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Keller! How was the war?  Did we win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly doesn't smile at this. He looks at the sandwiches a puts his finger to his chin in a gesture so facetious it' downright angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess. Happy Meals for the  wavy gravy wellness center?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe grabs two pieces of bread from a loaf. He looks kind. bit ill-used by life. The phrase "rode hard and put away  wet" comes to mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As usual, your cynicism is refreshing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes that sandwich and adds it to the pile. Kelly pauses while opening the refrigerator. His back  tightens. He slams the door with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As usual, your cheerful optimism  makes me ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe pauses over a slice of bread only briefly. The hostil is nothing new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly) You should get that checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly walks through the kitchen and out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, doc. Say hello to Leif  Garrett for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly opens the screen door and pokes his head in. A family of Chinese immigrants, the Lings, paints canvase at long worktables. There's a MOTHER, father MAO, grandmo XIOU-XIOU, SON and DAUGHTER. Finished canvases hang from the walls and lean in piles  against it. All of them are portraits of animals. Some ha on hats or clothes. Kelly's mom EVE shows grandmother XIOU-XIOU a few strokes with a paintbrush. Eve wears jeans. She's one of those young-looking mothers Kelly's friends would have crushes on. If he had any frie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) Son of Eve. You are very dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward) A rough charge. You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) Don't touch anything. We have to get  ready for the Starving Artist show. (to Xiou-Xiou) Now Nana, the gold has to be feathery,  not gloppy - see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve demonstrates on the painting - a pair of monkeys in F court dress. Kelly looks over his mom's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandmother Xiou-Xiou dabs at the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) She loves the gold. Always overuses  it. And usually her touch is so light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold is the color of the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve moves along the row, stopping to look at the painting in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why we never have anything  to eat in this house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Eve has stopped behind Mao's painting. She's not payi attention to Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mao, what did we say about the eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures at the image of a horse done Santa Fe style, lots of pastels, very abstract. Mao looks at her quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More - empathy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. And didn't I tell you  to put in more cacti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) No, no more cacti. Too busy.  Simplicity is best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His family nods in support of this rash aesthetic stateme Eve rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy. I'm not having this battle  with you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly breaks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because your husband takes food from  his own family to feed every loser  druggie in Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve moves down the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can always chip in here.  We're ordering pizza later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this the family nods and smiles to each other, pleased with the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Some people have to work later. (casual) Will you drop something off at the  dry cleaners for me tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks up at him for the first time. Takes in his filt uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, you know what we said about  paying for the war things. Nothing's  changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only thing I ever ask you  for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's important to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve stops at Mother Ling's painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just going to have to find a  way to pay for it yourself then, I  guess. (to Mother Ling) No - not that way - the sky should  be stormier. Angry clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Ling looks up at Kelly, who's scowling. She smiles and nods, understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I bother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly leaves. Eve's busy talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More brown, less blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes back in a grabs a sandwich off the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Keller, who needs that sandwich  more - you or the daughter of a crack  addict trying to make a new life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at him and bites into the sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the son of a heroin addict  trying to get ready for work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly leaves with the sandwich. Abe sighs and picks up mo bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That went well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the walls a poster for the Civil War miniseries next t one of Led Zeppelin. Some maps. A globe. Models of fighte planes and a set of old tin soldiers. Oh yeah, and his mom's ORIGINAL PAINTING, the one that st it all, this one signed by her - a very intense looking p rabbit glaring out of the canvas with huge eyes. He sits on the edge of the bed for a minute staring into  space before he peels off his muddy uniform piece by piec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the graveyard shift. Musak Steely Dan. Kelly unpacks cat food. Thousands and thousands of little cans of it. It's hard t keep the rows straight on the shelves. SARAH, the night cashier, stands at her register. She's p looking now but she'll be beautiful later when she figure out who she is. Not another soul in the store. Sarah wanders over to Kell aisle as if pulled by a magnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how'd your battle go today? I  still don't understand how you could  reenact the Battle of the Bulge in  seventy-two degree weather. (plays with hair) Didn't all those guys freeze to death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly doesn't stop working. He's got a system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a Port-a-John fell over on a  couple of guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War is hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly grabs another handful of cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly pauses. He puts two cans on the shelf very delibera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never more alive then when  facing simulated death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Maybe I should try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at her, thinks about this, and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are William J. Stone of the 1st  Airborne, pinned down in Noville.  The Germans have the high ground and  they're shelling your position  heavily. (starts throwing cans) You're holed up in a stone barn.  Sustaining heavy casualties. Running  low on ammo. The cries of wounded  men fill the air like the cries of  hungry babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah covers her head, huddled behind the boxes of cat fo dodging cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your commanding officer gets hit in  the face, dies. At 1 p.m. you lose  radio contact with headquarters. If  you withdraw, the Germans will flank  the entire Allied forces arrayed  along Bastogne and break the front.  What do you do? What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly goes back to stocking, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battle of Bulge, the Southern  Shoulder, December '44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stands up and starts to wander away but Kelly makes peace offering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Want a snack? We got a whole  shipment in of busted Oreo's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks at her feet, considering whether or not to ac it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll accidentally drop a couple pints  of milk and meet you over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Kelly sit on milk crates, pass the cookies back and forth and get philosophical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frozen food woman came in with  her kids. They must eat out of those  little cardboard trays every night.  One of the kids looked like cardboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know we stock more flavors of  cat food than we do baby food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen flavors of baby food including  the toddler meals-in-ajar, thirty- one flavors of cat food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fishes for a cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time you should tell that woman  to buy her kid some cat food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANGRY WOMAN pushes open the swinging door of the backr with her loaded shopping cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this store open? I've been waiting  up front. If the store's closed, it  shouldn't have a sign that says twenty- four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah gets up. Kelly stays right where he is, finishing a cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lot of coupons and I don't  want to be here when they expire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sarah) Charge her double for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah smiles and hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly walks down the hall with his army-issue BACKPACK sl over one shoulder. Besides a serious case of bedhead, he  looks normal. No one says hi to him as he makes his way to his locker. As he twirls the combination and opens it, he notices LAN short and wide, built like a tank, prematurely balding, a his girlfriend BRIDGET embracing a few lockers down. They kiss raunchily, their tongues darting in and out of  each other's mouths. Lance sees Kelly looking and stops kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you looking at, GI  Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shakes his head and gets a book out of his locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really, what makes you think you  can look at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honestly didn't know it was you. I  thought it was a free preview of the  Spice Channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty funny. You got dental  insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly closes his locker and walks away. Bridget wipes her mouth guiltily. Lance shakes his head and pulls Bridget to him, grinding pelvis against hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off in history class. The teacher MR. NORMAN shows slides on the Civil War. The more we see the clearer it becomes that they are his own  photos from a vacation spent visiting the memorials. Mr. Norman smiles out at his class in shot after shot. He clicks the remote and a photo of his WIFE, crouched ov and wearing shorts, drinking from a garden hose appears o screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries through to the next slide. It doesn't matter anyway. Everyone is almost asleep. Except Kelly, who becomes increasingly irritated the more Mr. Norman talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here, at Gettysburg, the ranks  of Union soldiers fought bravely on.  They were willing to give their lives  so that others might be free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shifts in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem Mr. Ernswiler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mr. Norman doesn't start talking again. He waits, looking at Kelly, smiling blandly. Until the si becomes uncomfortable. And Kelly gets mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Isn't this analysis a tad  simplistic? I mean, maybe for a second  grade history class, sure - but to  insist on still characterizing the  Civil War as some moral struggle?  The soldiers were drafted - the only  ones who had to fight were the ones  who couldn't afford to pay their way  out. (losing it) Why don't you talk about the Draft  Riots? Where are your slides for  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh flowers and a crocheted tissue box hoodie make the  place cozy. Kelly sits across the desk from PRINCIPAL HOLMSTEAD, a we groomed woman with a gentle talk show host demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gives you the idea that you can  or ought to question the curriculum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly doesn't move. He's not into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or question your teacher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I mean, who ever heard of a  classroom dialog? Not Socrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Holmstead is exasperated, but she likes him in spite herself. He's a smart cookie. She's got to change her  strategy. She leans back in her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, you're a very bright boy. But  you're making some serious mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to. Everyone else makes  them for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her chair SQUEAKS as she leans forward and looks at Kelly intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This anger must be masking a lot of  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering what the tissues  were for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holmstead tries again. She looks down at his file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're not going to college  next year. What are your plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shrugs. Holmstead searches his face for any clues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I get through to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advertisers use status and sex to  appeal to my demographic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head and swings her chair towards the wind and gazes out at the front walkway of the school. Her fac clears. Something's clicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can come up with a  punishment which might actually be  more of an opportunity for you to  realize your true potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School's been out for a while. The first rush had already left. Kelly comes down the front steps and starts across the pa lot to his Jeep. Lance steps out from behind an SUV and intercepts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You upset Bridget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly hardly stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, make out  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance runs and grabs Kelly's backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you fucking with me? You  little fucker. Want to play, fuckface?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just used fuck as a verb, noun,  and adjective. Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly tries to start walking again but Lance has hold of  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what Beetle Bailey's got  in his knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance grabs Kelly's arm and yanks it back. Kelly still se unconcerned. Suddenly he pulls away, but Lance keeps hold of his backp Lance holds the backpack up next to his head and points a it, gleeful. Lance walks away towards his car. Kelly runs after him. Lance holds Kelly off easily with one hand and throws the backpack into his SUV. They STRUGGLE for a minute, until  Lance pushes Kelly away, gets in the car. Kelly runs next to the car and pounds on the window as La drives off. Finally, Kelly gives up. Lance turns out of the parking l and HONKS the horn. Kelly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rim job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sifts through a pile of backpacks looking for a  replacement. From his post behind the counter, Bart sees and comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a couple days a month, to get a  heads-up on the latest stuff. What  are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for a backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all? Don't bother. I have a  couple extras at home. I could give  you one if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Sure, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stands a bit awkwardly waiting for Bart to get the from the desk to open the door in the corner. The door fi swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart and Kelly stand between shelves piled high with war  memorabilia. Uniforms in vacu-pac sealed bags, weapons in shoeboxes, cannonballs and tattered and gunsmoke-darkened flags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's real into hoarding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly holds up a flask in a leather case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant's field flask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Your dad should meet my history  teacher. He sent me to the principal's  office today for questioning his G- rated interpretation of the Civil  War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would, but now the principal's  making me give a speech on the Civil  War at an assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing in sympathy  and amusement) What is he, some kind of sadist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks she's doing me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, she must think you're really  screwed up. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on who you ask. Everyone's  got an opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs box) Take this. That'll shut them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart opens the long box. Nestled inside is a leg bone wit foot attached to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stonewall Jackson's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine that? Losing your  leg and getting back up on your horse?  Unbelievable. What balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods. That is balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got so much crap crammed in  here he doesn't even notice when  it's missing. I saw a backpack in  here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart puts down the box carelessly and paws through the pi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart and Kelly sit at the kitchen table drinking sodas,  waiting for MINNIE, the housekeeper, to finish making the dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he had a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd feel weird taking one out of the  tomb of Tutenkamen anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, you shouldn't. (burps) Where'd your old one go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. Kelly decides to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let someone take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't let him. I told off some  idiot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like your mouth gets you into  trouble a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's not me, it's  the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TABBY, Bart's older sister comes in. She's older. Definitely in college, if not out. And total shockingly beautiful. Otherworldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby, this is Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) Don't give him any money, whatever  you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these little old ladies are  looking for him in Arizona. He took  their retirement money and bought  defective bazookas with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly laughs. And looks at Tabby more closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny. We're paying attention  to you, are you happy now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, my life is complete. Fait  accompli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tabby) Minnie's making sloppy joes. Want  one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloppy joe? Sloppy no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the fridge and gets a yogurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go take a shower. Will you  call me when Miner gets here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby leaves. Kelly's distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Miner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fiancГ©.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart rolls his eyes, indicating what he thinks of good ol Miner. Kelly nods, doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm going to the flea market  on Saturday. I have a line on a couple  dealers. You could get a backpack  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly glances at the door Tabby left from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Flea market, land of  bargains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially if you know who to talk  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at Bart with suspicion -- and respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly hops out of his Jeep and walks towards the front of the school. Lance is there, hanging out with Bridget and some of his Magnon FRIENDS. He wears a WW II CAP, overseas airborne style, obviously  Kelly's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey fuckface. Like my new hat? I  just joined the Boy Scouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cro-Magnons grunt approvingly at this witty repartee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you stay in it long enough, maybe  you'll get your fudgepacker badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh. The Cro-Magnons laugh at Lance and EGG him on - "You gonna take that?"/"He just called you a fag", etc. Lance frowns and grabs Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a regular Howie Mandel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still holding on to him with one arm, he SLAPS Kelly hard across the face with the other. Kelly's knees give a bit. Lance holds him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance looks over at her and releases Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay babe. (to Kelly) One day you and me will be alone.  And won't that be nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is hurt but covering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad my mom won't let me date  yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly frowns and adjusts his clothes. Tries to re-wet the dry inside of his mouth with his tongue. He turns slowly and trudges up the stairs. Sarah has been watching the whole thing from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you mess with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I should give him a  break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly watches TV in the living room. His cheek has a nice bruise on it. Eve enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Kelly, you're home. Good. I need  you to go to the art supply store  for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Abe to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve goes to her purse and rifles through it to find her  wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going to but he had to go  lead a meeting at Care House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have I heard that before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to give me a break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly jabs at the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me think - maybe when I finally  forget every single word of The Little  Mermaid soundtrack I'd listen to in  the car waiting for him to score.  No, probably when I don't prepare  myself before I go into the bathroom,  expecting to find him passed out on  the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve waits through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, you know what? I know I'll  be able to put it all behind me when  I go away to college. (slaps his forehead,  pretend remembering) Only, I can't go because someone  spent my college fund on Mexican  Black Tar. So looks like I'll have  to try to forget at Shop Rite, where  I'll be working for the rest of my  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. You have every reason  to crawl into the corner and give  up. But please just get me some paints  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve comes over to Kelly. He sighs and puts his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need burnt sienna, cadmium red,  and midnight blue. Two tubes of blue. (looks at him) What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hand up but he moves away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks through the paints, picking out tubes. He loo up and sees Tabby browsing the paintbrushes. He's suddenly nervous. He knocks over a few cans of thinn Almost leaves. Instead, he gathers his courage, goes to the display oppo hers and waits to catch her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're having a sale on glitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Tabby a second to recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello. What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Tennis injury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby looks at him suspiciously like she's not sure wheth to believe him. Tabby finishes with the mediums and moves onto the paints Kelly follows her, staying in the opposite aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you see... That's a difficult  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really feel comfortable  calling anything done since the  Renaissance "painting." We might  have a more experimental interaction  with the picture plane, but our skills  have suffered from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In spite of herself, Tabby laughs at this. This gives Kel more confidence. He leans over the aisle to see what she' looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working with acrylic. Why?  Oil's much - richer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you're not one of those oil snobs  are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes around and leans nonchalantly against the she knocks more things over and fumbles to replace them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just - isn't acrylic a bit -  jejune?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jejune? You're jejune. How old are  you anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Older than my years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby walks to the counter with her brushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you paint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks down and partially confesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, my mother's kind of  an artist, so -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That explains it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby signs the slip and takes the bag. She walks out, Ke with her, matches her pace, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That explains nothing. Doesn't anyone  believe in innate knowledge anymore?  Michelangelo was fifteen when he  painted the Infanta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infantas are Spanish. Michelangelo  was Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby gets into her car. Kelly leans into her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. One world, one people. Just  like Jesse Jackson envisioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby tries to conceal her smile and starts her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - Kelly. Nice talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives away. Kelly stands there watching. Then he win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly pulls up in his Jeep. He turns off the engine but  doesn't get out. Just sits there. He doesn't want to go i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colored plastic flags droop in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY STALL
dialogues.text: Bart sweeps his eye over everything. A SKINNY GUY wearing wife beater has some not half-bad stuff. Kelly, bruise faded to yellow and green, examines a glass mason jar of what seems to be dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) That there's actual sand from Iwo  Jima.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or your sister's sandbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it don't come with no  certificate of authenticity. (considers) I could write one up for you, I  suppose. Get it notarized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's quite all right. Actually,  I'm in the market for medals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I got a couple purple hearts.  A Silver Star. DSC. Can't sell them  to you though. They were gramp's. (wink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart acts casual, hands clasped behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a lot of sentimental value  -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart pulls out a paper bag and offers it to the skinny gu who looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Ulysses S. Grant's field  flask, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is shocked. The skinny guy looks at his suspiciousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw in one of those backpacks and  we'll call it even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skinny guy looks at Bart, and in the bag again. He go to get the backpack. Kelly's impressed by this smooth  exchange.

dialogues.speaker: FLEA MARKET
dialogues.text: Kelly and Bart weave through the maze of stands. Kelly no holds the backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buying and selling US service medals  is illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. That's why the resale value  is so high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what they teach you at  Langely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so naГЇve. We all have our  skeletons. Some of them just pay  more than others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm not even going to ask about  the flask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask, don't tell. The army gets  everything right, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: CAMPAIGN PIN STALL
dialogues.text: A frowsy WOMAN in a muumuu sits fanning herself in front an extensive display of pins and buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys look like Goldwater fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been accused of that  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well jeez, you don't have to be  insulted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything military?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman considers this, her fan working back and forth  lazily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish around in that cigar box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart paws through the box. Acts casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want for the box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so hasty. (fanning) I got a few Geraldine Ferraro pins  I'm looking to unload.

dialogues.speaker: FLEA MARKET FOOD COURT
dialogues.text: Kelly and Bart, now wearing the smiling black & white of Geraldine Ferraro, eat disgusting yet delicious flea m food and watch a slow-motion bingo game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldwater fan. I think that's some  kind of insult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at Dartmouth. Where are you going  to go to school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, you have that luxury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I didn't have much say in the matter.  Everything has been decided for me  since birth. I'm not whining about  it. Play the hand you're dealt, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say. You got a royal  flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? My life sucks.  Everyone's always telling me what to  do. You can't fight it. Go with the  flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat for a minute to the soothing sounds of the BINGO CALLER: TWENTY-ONE, THIRTEEN, FOUR, SEVENTY-EIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Tabby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got to go where she wanted. Sarah  Lawrence. Six years. She's almost  done with grad school. Yale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think people actually went  to Yale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) I don't know. I mean, she drives off  in her car in September. For all we  know, she could just pull her car  over in Albany and sleep there until  May.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a joke. Joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart does some fake sign language to help Kelly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Is that what one of those sounds  like? Somehow, I always imagined  they would be funnier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart pushes Kelly, who grabs his arm like it got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Lawrence? Isn't that for  lesbians?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the backpack incident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with mad cow-diseased  hamburger meat for brains? That would  be the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interested, Bart leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to lower myself to his  level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. But there are  alternativesВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alternatives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you ever heard of the 193rd  Special Operations Wing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well do you want to get this guy or  what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's get the fuck out of  here, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart tosses his wrapper at the trashcan. Kelly watches it hit the rim and go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the move) I have some things to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart and Kelly sit amidst a spread of books, papers, and  electronic equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we've gathered the intelligence,  the plan will reveal itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't plan first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart opens a pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it limits our scope - what's the  objective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humiliation. Rage. Despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy enough. 'Nam's probably our go- to war for that sort of thing. I  have the declassified briefs from  the Phoenix Project around here  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart grabs a book and starts flipping through pages. Tabby enters with an armful of art supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I have some stretcher bars out  in the car. Can somebody help me  bring them in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we'll drop what we're doing  because what you're doing must be  more important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart doesn't look up. He grabs another book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I mean, I'll help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart raises his eyebrow. Kelly shrugs off the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find those reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby drops the canvas and points at the table. Kelly dum the bars and stands there looking around. At the wood floors and skylights. Couch covered with a sh Painting, serious ones, with layers of paint and mysterio objects stuck to them lay against the walls. They all see faded, like a vacation photo that's been through the wash Kelly moves to the PAINTING on the easel. Very yellow and pink. Kind of looks like castles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold. The color of the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby wrestles with the bolt of canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the Cleveland waterfront.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the viewer, I get to decide what  it is, I'm afraid. And it doesn't  look a thing like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the light. I was playing with  diffusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well make sure you put it away when  you're done with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny, wiseass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly resumes his tour of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be nice to have a place like  this to get away to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Farmer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby unrolls the canvas and measures lengths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Miner? What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he an artist, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Definitely not. Thank god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is silent for a while, fiddling with a clamp light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said your mom was a painter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was, well - is I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby cuts the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She used to be. But then my dad -  wasn't working anymore so she turned  it into a business. She has a family  of Chinese immigrants in the garage  making them for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Andy Warhol's Factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like Andy Warhol's tool shed.  It was nice before, though. My playpen  used to be in her studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. So you really grew up with it.  What does, did, your dad do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a VH-1 documentary without the  music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tragedy struck?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And then, things took a turn for  the worse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just wait. Those burnout types  always have a triumphant comeback  tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already changed the channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby sits back on her heels and looks at him. Bart's head appears in the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ Kelly, I let you go out on a  little supply line assist and you're  gone for days. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only it were fun. War's deadly  serious, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bart) And I used to think you were the  only crazy one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough with the mind pollution, Hanoi  Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart leaves. Kelly stands by the door. This is his only  chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about you playing with  diffusion unsupervised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I might have to come by and  show you the proper safety procedures.  Some time in the presence of an art  prodigy would do you good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I have room for a  playpen in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby smiles. Kelly leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart and Kelly walk across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you have a thing for my sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They skirt around the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just have a few things in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really, like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you. It's my feminine  side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't wear women's clothes when  you're alone, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes out of the kitchen with a glass of water in p bottoms and a T-shirt. The TV's on static. He sees a FIGU sleeping on the couch and starts to walk through the room Then he stops, sighs, and backtracks. He turns off the TV Then he sees the empty bottle of wine next to the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure doesn't move. Kelly doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks around, worried. In this house an unresponsiv dad isn't necessarily sleeping. Should he wake up his mom He shakes the figure slightly. It rolls over, only it's n his dad. It's some scabby ADDICT. Kelly yanks his hand aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe sits on a lawn chair. Kelly comes out, unfolds another chair and sits next to h dad - a good distance away. They both look up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller. There's a meteor shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A funny thing just happened. A little  trip down memory lane. I thought you  were on our couch, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean Emmett? They didn't  have an empty bed for him at Care  House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods, considering this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's one of your more brilliant  ideas. (anger rising) Have you thought about the fact that  it might be dangerous? That he might  steal something, or go into cardiac  arrest? Drink all our cooking wine?  Which he seems to have done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just needs a place to sleep for  the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Besides, having him  here makes it feel like home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe slams his hands down on the arms of his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been straight for four years,  almost five. A third of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly claps slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big whoop. I've been straight the  whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to tell you this, but I'm not  your problem anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's the one thing I get to  decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe looks at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know. I can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. Kelly shakes his head and goes  inside. Abe looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Keller, there's a meteor shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a backyard tree house next door sit Kelly and Bart, Ke looking through a pair of M3 field glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the target in sight.

dialogues.speaker: BINOCULAR MATTE
dialogues.text: Through the twin circles Lance gets into his car in front his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see. Don't be a farb, give  them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly hands the glasses over. Bart looks through them. Th he puts them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys looks at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me prepare to deploy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart opens up a duffel bag and pulls out a yellow jumpsui which he puts on. Kelly looks through the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this going to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've planned for every contingency  using the tried and true techniques  of the last great world power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for the press conference.

dialogues.speaker: THE LAWN
dialogues.text: The boys climb down out of the tree house. Bart is dressed in an official-looking yellow jumpsuit wi telephone repairmen's tool hanging from his belt and a ha hat on. Kelly carries a toolbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay low. On my signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Kelly. Then he holds up one finger and gestur "go." They sneak hunched over towards the fence. A LITTLE GIRL comes out of the house and stops when she sees them. Bart and Kelly look at each other. Bart takes the toolbox and gestures to Kelly by pointing at the girl and coverin his mouth. Kelly peels off towards the girl while Bart continues acr the lawn. The girl starts to SCREAM. Kelly swoops up and covers her mouth with his hand. He tucks her under his arm and runs  towards the opposite side of the house. He puts the girl down, still covering her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the good guys. If you scream,  the bad guys are going to come and  burn down your house. Okay? So stay  here and be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl nods. Kelly takes his hand off her mouth and sta to sneak away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad has a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly runs across the street to get a view of the front d

dialogues.speaker: IN FRONT OF LANCE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bart turns up the driveway and RINGS the doorbell. LANCE'S MOTHER opens the door. Bart confers with her brie and steps inside. The door closes behind him. Kelly stares so hard at the door he doesn't see the NEIGH come up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you, young man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly starts and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just inspecting your lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly grabs a few blades of grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about Astroturf? It  takes a lot less water to keep green.  I mean, no water, technically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I see. Okay then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gets up and starts to walk down the street, only -  Lance PULLS UP in his SUV. Kelly darts behind a parked car and watches Lance go into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance comes right back out. He forgot something in his ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly moves around the car, trying to keep it between him and Lance. Bart comes down the front walk whistling and eating a coo He smiles at Lance, now coming back up the walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile worker bee. I'll be your boss  some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart nods and tips his HARD HAT. Kelly follows him on the other side of the row of cars un Lance's house is out of sight. Then he gets in step beside Bart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an asshole. His mom gave me  cookies, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get it done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask stupid questions. Let's go  home and listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys sit around an FM receiver/recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a five-watt FM bug, so we  should be in range -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart FLIPS the ON switch and Lance's Mom's voice fills th room. The boys smile with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then I told her, "Harriet, with  potato salad like that it's no wonder  Ray-Ray's cheating on you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. But I was thinking it.  Instead I just told her to add more  vinegar next time, and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shakes his head as the women natter away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we can use any of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be patient. It's voice activated, so  we'll get everything. Trust me. It's  going to be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gets up to leave while Bart fiddles with the knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reconnoiter tomorrow at nineteen  hundred hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe and Eve have dinner together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And if we don't sell them there,  we'll set up on the corner of Stevens  and Lane, by the gas station. That's  a good location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at her husband and sees he's not paying attenti He seems a little out of it. He's pushing his food around his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you make this with more chili  pepper than usual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same as always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes in, walks through the kitchen and up the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly. Want dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents eat for a minute in silence. Abe winces and p down his fork. Eve smiles tenderly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day, we're all going to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe puts his hand over hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart moves around the room excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really too perfect, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't describe. Just hit play.  It's all cued up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly hits a button. The tape clicks ON. From the speaker comes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recorded) I told you, that makes me nervous.  Me no likey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But baby, my birthday's coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still. That's not a good enough  reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. A little action. A little  prime time action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But people might see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point. That's what makes  it sexxxy. Dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart and Kelly share a look. Kelly grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's draw up the plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a few notes jotted down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we have to do is fill in the details and let Operatio Deadmeat begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridget primps at her locker while Kelly watches nervousl from his. When she starts to close the locker door, Kelly rushes to her and BUMPS into her. Her books and papers spill to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, I'm so sorry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts picking them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's okay -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around. If Lance showed up it wouldn't be good either of them. Kelly hands her the rest of her stuff. They part ways. Kelly shoves a piece of paper into his pocket. Principal Holmstead CLICKS down the hall in her heels and Kelly DUCKS into a doorway just in time. He turns and pre to look at a posted announcement as she passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart inspects Bridget's book report with a jeweler's loop He swings over to a piece of stationary Kelly's working o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dots her I's with hearts. And  her L's are loopier. The L is very  important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both crouch over the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel kind of bad for her. She's a  nice girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes collateral damage can't be  avoided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes back from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does that look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inspecting) Pretty good. I think we're ready to  manufacture a document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly takes out a fresh sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clears his throat) Begin. "Hey Daddy. It's your birthday  and you've been a very bad boy. But  so has the baby. Both baby and Daddy  have to get punished, only this time  -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance, shirtless, reads aloud from the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cont.) - baby makes the rules. Await further  instructions at school tomorrow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart wears his school uniform and sits in the passenger s next to Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.O. cont'd) -- Baby will be waiting where Daddy  least expects her. Love, Bridgie."  Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly just looks at him. Bart's already asked this questi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't afford any errors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to tell me. It's my  ass on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly pulls up in front of Bart's school. Bart turns to him and puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could be there to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get the de-brief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a day that will live in infamy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't do any better than that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear you coming up with  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart hops out and salutes Kelly, who give him the thumbs in response and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance can't keep his hands off Bridget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gotten into you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, you bad girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance cackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you drink a bottle of Robitussin  before school again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon, my naughty baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridget looks a little scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance slouches into a seat next to Kelly, who drops anoth STATIONARY NOTE into Lance's open backpack. Kelly watches as Lance grabs his book, sees the note, ope it, and leers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my birthday! I'm going to get a  present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks down at his desk and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, fuckface. What're you smiling  about? You wish you were me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Palmer? May I be excused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance leaves like a house afire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Eine maus findet den kase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance sneaks down the hall towards the STORAGE CLOSET and whispers into the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's here for the Easter egg hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls open the door. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance turns on the light. No one there. But propped up on the shelf next to a vase with a rose in is another note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, push my buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches the note. His eyes widen as he reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Oh yeah. You little minx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart crouches in the stall, looking at his watch. When the second hand sweeps past the twelve, he opens his cell phone and punches in a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious grownup voice) Yes, I need to get a message to  Bridget Shumann. This is MENSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunchtime. Typical bedlam. KIDS mill around. At one end of the cafeteria/gym is a small stage, the kin pep rallies are held on. Lance edges his way through the crowd, making a beeline f the STAGE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confused Bridget stands at the SECRETARY'S desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just got this note last period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't have anything here for  you - let me look again. Oh yes, the  MENSA called.
