dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secretary hands Bridget the message. She looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. They want me to be an honorary  member. (pause) Is that like a sorority or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance looks around eagerly. He peeks through the curtains at all the kids and can bar contain his excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridgie? Come on, daddy's sick. He  needs his medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots a WOMAN in the shadows. It must be Bridget. He unbuckles his pants and lets them drop to him knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought our friend along. He's  happy to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rips off his shirt and shuffles across the dark stage  toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart looks at his watch in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly flicks a switch and presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd falls silent and turns towards the mechanical s of the STAGE CURTAIN OPENING. They squint from the BRIGHT STAGE LIGHTS. SHOCK ripples through the crowd as they take in the table revealed to them: A frozen half-naked Lance on his knees before a BLOW-UP D tied to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you all looking  at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridget, standing in the doorway, covers her mouth in hor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he's got a hard on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eeeeew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance stumbles off stage to HOOTS and CATCALLS, but mostl hysterical LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly smiles, laughs and claps his hands with delight. Th he returns to military precision. He turns all the switch back to how they were and uses his shirtsleeve to cover t doorknob so as not to leave fingerprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart pours them two glasses of his dad's scotch. He's  overjoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. There it was. The whole school  saw it. Wasn't too impressive either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise their glasses to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Operation Mincemeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the 193rd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both take swallows of scotch. Kelly retches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel to give better than  you get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly finishes his scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (croaking) Don't mind if I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drink again. Kelly's feet are up. For the first time, looks comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stands at her register, flipping through a magazine Kelly pulls up on the ELECTRO-SHOPPER with field goggles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his foot down like a kickstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen volts of pure freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it is. Unless you know how to  handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly runs his hand lovingly along the frame. Then he loo up at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever seen the freshly waxed floor  in the produce section glistening  under full florescence? It's  breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah gets on behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his foot up and kicks it into gear. The Electro-shopper takes off - barely. Kelly takes the c too sharp and clips the edge of an END CAP DISPLAY of cer boxes -- they fall to the floor. The Electro-shopper inches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks in at his parents, checking to make sure they still asleep. When he leaves ABE opens his eyes and listens to the door CLOSE downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly throws some paints and brushes into his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stands awkwardly on the front stoop with his backpa Minnie opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly? Bart's not here, he -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's all right. Actually, I'm  here to see Tabby. Just to do a little  painting with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out back in her studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby stands barefoot in the sunlight, a palette knife in her hand. Music's playing. Jeff Buckley. She looks over as the door opens, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I warned you I'd come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back to painting. Kelly stands there for a minut waiting for her to say something else, give him an invita She doesn't. Until she looks up and sees him standing in same place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you're here now. Go ahead. Set  your canvas up. Use one of the ones  in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks through them and picks one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brushes are in the jar. Paint's in  the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off his backpack and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly busies himself pulling out paints and other supplie He can't help but look at her. The light hits her hair an she glows. She catches him looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it mess up your concentration?  Me being here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to her painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sets up his canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I'm kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Irony. I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly feels the tubes of paint. Nervous. Squirts some col out. Looks over his shoulder at her. He's trying to get his act together, to be cool about bei there, in the studio, alone with her. Trying to figure ou how to play it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miner opens the door. See Kelly. Smiles like the stockbro he is and crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miner Webber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miner holds out his hand for a good old-fashioned shake. Kelly takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webber Miner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miner looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly. This is Kelly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly Ernswiler. Sorry. I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite all right. (smiles as an  afterthought) So, what do we have here, a little  painting class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's a friend of Bart's. He paints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? What's your real job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly smiles eagerly at Miner over the edge of his canvas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be stock boy at the Shop  Rite. But, as President Don Kaminsky  says, every employee is part owner.  So you could say I'm a captain-of- industry in training. Kind of  capitalist larva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's quite an image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you see the most magical  part. Do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly spreads his arms out and flaps them a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day I'll be a beautiful butterfly.  First I'll have to be a pupa though.  I figure I won't be going out much  then. Pupa: the awkward adolescence  of the insect world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miner stares at Kelly. He can't tell what he might be mak fun of, or if it might be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes to get you through  the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly rolls his eyes at this uninspired response, though  Miner doesn't see it. He grabs Tabby's paintbrush and pul her to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the afternoon off. Come away  with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not at a good stopping point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. They'll still be here. (to Kelly) I know you'll still be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly smiles his most idiotic energetic smile and slaps p on his canvas in exaggerated strokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But everyone will be coming soon.  And it will get all crazy, and we  won't have any time to ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby kisses Miner. He realizes there's no convincing her and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like tonight? We can practice  honeymoon suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miner looks at Kelly, who looks away. Then he puts his hands in his pockets and leaves. Tabby and Kelly paint in silence for a while. Kelly moves around to look at his canvas from different angles, like  he's copying what he thinks a painter would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he always like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overbearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby stops and puts down her brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because he didn't want to picture  you as a pupa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he will - later. When he's alone.  Whether he wants to or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly paints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that though. How he wanted you  to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to be with me. What's so  bad about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because some one wants to be  with you doesn't mean they're good  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is suddenly very involved with his painting. He has hard time making eye contact with Tabby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one should ever ask you to stop.  If you stop, you might not be able  to start again. Or you might start  again, only things will be different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's sweet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not sweet, actually. It's just  the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the month. But don't  ask me about it. It makes me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at her seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you painting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops and sighs, now back in serious artist mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, there are so many layers of  - imagistic symbolism - that I really  don't feel comfortable summing it  up, but, well - it's a recurring  dream image. A mermaid riding a rocket  ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby stops painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "how?" Sidesaddle.  She's riding it sidesaddle. She's  got a fish tail, for chrissake. I  haven't decided yet if she's got  scuba gear on or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what you're  talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly puts up his thumb in an approximation of an artist' gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, some people actually say what  they really think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they don't know what they  really think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. It's called being  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not boring. Scary and wonderful and  exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops squeezing paint onto his palette. His gesture slow down. He's taking this in. Then he shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm trying to create here. Stop  distracting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes in to return the art supplies. Xiou-Xiou's alone working. She looks up and smiles at Kel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's got you working late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly walks over and sees what she's working on. A beauti spare Chinese landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You're really good. Why do you  make those stupid animals for mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each painting is a lesson. Here -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out a piece of paper for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making a lot of art these days.  I guess that means a lot of lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each line has a whole drawing  contained in it. Each drawing has a  whole life contained in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly watches her for a minute, the delicate whoop and sw of her strokes. He dips a brush into the ink and watches Xiou-Xiou's  restrained and confident movements. Eve leans against the doorframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you two. I'll try not to act  surprised. It might spoil the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly puts down the paintbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller, I think I'm missing some art  supplies. Have you seen them around  the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly avoids her eyes as he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son is not yet cooked. Give him  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks over Xiou-Xiou's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to let me give  you your own show? We could do it  for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. When you offer me an  eighty-twenty split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly eats with the Bowlands - Bart's mom, MATHILDA, his HARRISON, and Tabby and Bart. The Bowlands dress up a bit for dinner, like any good Was family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harrison) -- But I told you I want to take  German --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: German's a Cold War language. You  can't get any kind of State Department  position without more diverse  linguistic training than that. You'll  take Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we on the same page?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters) Same page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone eats in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tabby) So darling, when are you going to  bite the bullet and do the seating  arrangement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby puts down her fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't deal with that stuff, ma. I  don't care who sits next to whom. I  should have eloped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, Mrs. Bowland, sometimes  when you bite the bullet, it explodes  in your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathilda looks surprised. This could go either way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively) Why, I've never thought about it  before but that is a rather strange  expression, isn't it? You wouldn't  say, "Sooner or later you've got to  put the grenade in your pants," would  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But have you ever noticed how in  movies they always bite the grenade  before they throw it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but they never take a bite out  of their pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone but Bart LAUGHS. Tabby throws Kelly a grateful glance, for getting her out a conversation she didn't want to have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an unusual conversation! Do you  have similar discussions at the dinner  table with your family, Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically. I ask why all the furniture  is missing and my Dad reminisces  about dropping acid and watching  Neil Armstrong walk on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All but Bart LAUGHS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talks about art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks down at his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's kind of an artist, so -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come from a creative family, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathilda salts her food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish my boys would talk to me about  my passions. I can't get them anywhere  near the subject of my garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed your magnolias. Very fine  specimens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are fine, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathilda beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic) Is there nothing you can't discuss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone notices the slight edge to Bart's voice, they i it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Kelly, try a bit of these leeks.  Minnie has a way with the white sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and Bart play PlayStation II "Medal of Honor" in Ba bedroom. Bart is sulking, almost imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad has this friend who's a  director. He's shooting a documentary  for the History Channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs some guys to do a reenactment  of some European theater battles for  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops playing and looks at Bart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be on the History  Channel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart's eyes stay on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't asked you yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly jabs at his controller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you want to. Next weekend.  But you have to take it seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gives Bart a derisive glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Of course I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flickering TV light illuminates Bart's pinched look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what I've seen, you play fast  and loose with your characterizations.  This has got to be straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This annoys Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not "fast and loose." I play the  emotional truth. I make it real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like back in the dining room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimics) "I noticed your magnolias. Very fine  specimens." That was real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's video game character dies. He drops the controlle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) You just seem to have your own agenda,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart plays on. He's keeping a lid on everything while Kel gets more and more agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own agenda? What other reason is  there to do anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. I know the difference  between fantasy and reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at Bart in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart won't meet his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart pauses the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me your dad was  a burn-out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gets up and grabs his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you steal from yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. Bart un-pauses the game and continues playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly drinks from the fountain and wipes his mouth on his sleeve. Principal Holmstead's smiling face greets him when he  straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly! I told some of your teachers  about your presentation. We're all  really looking forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly frowns at the Principal's back as she CLICKS away. Sarah appears. They walk down the hall together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What presentation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it. As a  matter of fact, do me a favor and  pretend you never heard anything  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Um.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly starts to pull ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an extra ticket to Aerosmith  this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw Sarah, that's really great, I  mean. It's just that - I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah, I figured. Okay. I'll see  you in the dairy section, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there looking lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly smoothes the cover over his Jeep. Bart pulls up to curb in his BMW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tracked you down. There's someone  I'd like you to meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few OLD SOLDIERS sit sunning in chairs in the industria feeling living-room. Bart and Kelly sit across from CHARLIE HAYES, an old blac guy, playing dominos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) Are you one too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you see in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living, dying, camaraderie, bravery  - the big stuff. Things we don't  have anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sorts his tiles and scowls. He leans in to Kelly' face, giving him the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you think it's brave getting  trench foot and syphilis, eating  another ration of spoiled frank and  beans out of a dented can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is taken aback by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie leans back and nods, thinking about Kelly's respo He no longer seems angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that wouldn't be much fun,  would it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sets down a tile and pulls at his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parts of it were kind of fun though.  I got separated from my platoon and  lived for two weeks in the forest of  the Ardennes living off what I could  kill. (pause) I felt very close to the land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart gives Kelly a significant look. Kelly doesn't notice He's looking closely at Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sits in the car. Bart pumps gas. They talk through window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met him when my mom made me go  around caroling with the Youth Group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't really believe that stuff  about Berlin? And Hitler's compound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it matters. Doesn't the  truth matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly avoids this by getting out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a drink. Let me borrow a couple  bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to play him for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to be nice. He's your  friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart returns the pump and screws in the gas cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. You should know better.  What do you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mountain Dew -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then he glances towards the gas station and sees EVE set up in the adjacent abandoned lot. She's got the van p there with the sliding door open and paintings propped ar on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Eve has seen him. She shields her eyes with her hand calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly backtracks towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman's calling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve walks over to them. Kelly can't get out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Bart. Meet my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve smiles brightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a nice surprise. It's so nice  to finally meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart is surprised but recovers his manners quickly, just  like he's been taught to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise. So, doing a little business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little is right. But I work it as  much as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve laughs. Kelly shifts his weight from foot to foot. Eve looks at b of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what have you boys been up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart took me to meet his friend  Charlie at the Old Soldiers' Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie at the Old Soldiers' Home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys should swing by Care House.  There are some Vets there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well - okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve watches a car pull into the lot next to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go. But you boys should  come over to our house some time. (to Bart) I know your family must get tired of  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly visibly bristles at the thought of his parents  entertaining Bart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. But I'd love to, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at Kelly. Then she runs back over to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. Now you know everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem? She's pretty  cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly rolls his eyes and gets back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want your soda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly watches Bart pick through parts of his uniform. After the encounter with mom, he's retreated into himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So filming's on Saturday. Can you  make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. It's gonna be really cool.  He's got an explosives expert coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly runs his hand through his hair. He can't bring hims to say what's really on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that stupid speech?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly picks up Bart's Colt and sights with it. Bart frown He knows Kelly's avoiding the real stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to give it next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart polishes his combat boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should talk to my dad about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he'd go for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart keeps his head down, polishes intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. He loves you. He was  talking the other day about helping  you out. (ironic) Want to go to Dartmouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was. If you applied for Spring  Semester, he could "pull some  strings."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head slowly) I don't think that would work for  me. Considering -- my background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, probably not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not properly socialized. I  wouldn't fit in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart checks his bandoleer and cartridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to my family. They're like  your fucking fan club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart pauses, darts his eyes at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Tabby likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much she ratted me out to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's inviting you to the  wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart watches Kelly's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you probably won't enjoy that  much, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about. Weddings? I love weddings. I  always get drunk and make out with  someone's cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart throws his olive drab socks at Kelly's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I'll call mom's nephew Fletcher  and tell him to expect a little  action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's twelve. Let me give some advice.  He's very into sharks at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly waves to Minnie and goes out the front door. There he pauses, trying to decide what to do. Then he sco He goes around the corner. Towards Tabby's studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby sits on the couch facing away from the door. Kelly  enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby turns toward him. She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows he should leave, but Kelly just stands there. Kelly runs his hand along his pants in a nervous gesture. Tabby dabs at her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miner and I broke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly? I didn't think you two  were right for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly walks over to her painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this painting. Stare at it too  long and you can't see it anymore.  But if someone else sees it for the  first time, they can tell exactly  what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need any more bullshit right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops, taken aback. He walks away from the painting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could never understand you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not as complicated as you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly walks to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said you were complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby laughs/cries at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just wasn't the right one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby nods. She's starting to calm down a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more to it than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby looks at her shredded tissue. Kelly sits down on th couch next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry. I really am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly pats her knee awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby turns her face to Kelly's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like me, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean -- you like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks scared. He wants to retreat. But he calms him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think you're amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause. Then -- Kelly kisses her. She kisses back and they fall against the couch together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart comes out in his pajamas to turn off the sprinkler. looks up and freezes. Kelly comes out of Tabby's studio. He shuts the door care and walks around the pool. Kelly doesn't see Bart. Bart doesn't say anything. He just watches Kelly go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly throws parts of his soldier's kit onto his bed from corners of the room. The canteen underhand. The Jeep cap a free throw. This is the best day of his life. Until he finds his uniform crumpled up behind the door, s crusted with mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. Damn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flops on his bed. But he can't help it. Soon he's smil again. He gets up, gathers up the uniform, and tears out the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes down the stairs two at a time, singing. Eve and Abe watch surprised from the table. Abe looks pal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart sits in his desk chair, frowning. Mathilda knocks and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minnie's starting dinner. Is Kelly  coming over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight, ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathilda pauses and looks at her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ASSISTANT DIRECTOR and CAMERAMAN unload equipment from van. The DIRECTOR looks off into the distance, trying to visua Kelly pulls up next to the van. He wears a spotlessly cle uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you with the 101st or the 82nd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, 82nd today. It's not my usual  division. Technically, my patches  indicate -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Make yourself comfortable.  We'll be a while setting up. Some of  the other boys are over by craft  service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly doesn't go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snack table. It's over there.  Someone will come get you when we're  ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Is Bart Bowland here yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart? Oh, Harrison's son. I don't  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CRAFT SERVICE
dialogues.text: Kelly and a half dozen other SOLDIERS stand or sit in the grass around the table. They talk and rest on their backp A MAKEUP ARTIST makes the rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kelly) And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly Ernswiler, private first class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Kelly. Let's take a look  at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out some pomade and runs a comb through his hair slicking it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly grins. When she walks away he messes up his hair ag He scans the crowd. No Bart. The A.D. walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone. We're going to start  positioning. Then we'll go through a  few rehearsals. (points at soldiers) You, you and you - go over there by  that tree. You and you guys, behind  the hill. (looks at clipboard) Okay, who's got the Jeep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That MG? She's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. We'd like to use it. Can you  drive it beyond the hill over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly tries to act casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I don't think that would be a  problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks towards his Jeep and pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Bart Bowland? Has he  checked in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. We've got enough people.  It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods, wondering a bit. But it's soon forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jeep) Hot Lips, old girl, you're going to  be famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells) Okay people. Listen to my voice.  From now on, you do whatever this  voice says. Take your place.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE HILL
dialogues.text: Kelly waits with his rifle next to his Jeep, bored. He sees a FIGURE in the shadows of the trees. He raises his rifle and points it at the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Password.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart steps out of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put you over here with me? That's  great. I think we'll get some close- ups. They want me to drive old Lippy.  Isn't that awesome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ought to fucking kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly shakes his head, avoiding Bart's eyes, trying to ke it normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just do whatever the fuck you  want. And consequences don't matter,  do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart looks at Kelly. Sees nothing but a kid in an old Arm uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you think she's  going to do, run off with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood rises to Kelly's face. But he still won't look at Bart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a seventeen-year-old bag boy.  She's a Yale grad student. Talk about  living in a fucking fantasy world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's hands turn white around the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You'd rather have me be miserable  like you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart comes closer. Uncomfortably close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (biting sarcasm) Once again, you've displayed your  uncanny ability to nail the truth of  a character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly finally raises his head. And looks Bart right in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking out your dad's mouth  and use your own for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart lunges at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera's set up. The groups are in position. The A.D. stands by the cameraman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standby for rehearsal. Cue the  explosion.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY CLOUD EXPLODES
dialogues.text: In the field. Soldiers leap out of trenches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cue the Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cue the Jeep. Cue the fucking Jeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The A.D. shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE BARN
dialogues.text: The A.D. comes around the corner followed by the camerama Bart and Kelly roll around on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the H. Christ is going on over  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart and Kelly continue to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cameraman) Hey, roll this. Get this. Are you  getting this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cameraman puts his camera up to his eye and films. Kelly finally pushes Bart off him, gets in his Jeep and d away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cameraman) Follow him. Are you getting it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart sits on the ground, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can use this. We'll cut it  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The A.D. directs the camera at Bart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get close on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart pushes the camera away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly lays in bed staring at the ceiling. There's a cut a his eyebrow. Eve comes in carrying her car keys and sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're going to have to. Your  father's at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of his loser friends ended  up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve plays with her keys. Then she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think he has stomach cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly feels the sensation of falling, like a dream. Then he snorts and rolls over, away from his mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh this is just perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at the back of Kelly's head. She's tired but st trying to deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you say something like  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it seems to fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Seems to fit." Do you understand  what I just said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gets up. Puts his feet on the floor. His shoulders slumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, do you want to say it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and holds the door open for her. Eve looks at  him, heart heavy. She leaves. Kelly sits on the bed. Then he looks at the rabbit painti He grabs it off the wall and SLAMS it backwards against t floor so he doesn't have to look at it. The painting falls back against the bayonet fixed to Kell rifle and TEARS. He KICKS it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly angrily wrestles with giant boxes of paper towels. He RIPS open the box and they roll everywhere. Sarah watches from checkout. She comes over to help him p them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to tell you this box was  booby-trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concert was lame. The opening  act singer ripped his leather pants  during a stupid dance routine and  stormed off stage. (pause, looks at his  cut) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gathers an armful of paper towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah puts a couple of rolls on the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I don't have a perfect life, if  that's what you're asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sarah, actually, I'm not asking.  I never ask you anything but you  just talk anyway. Have you ever  noticed that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah drops the rolls she had in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Kelly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, still in his work clothes, comes in without knocki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I hoped you were up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops when he sees Tabby and Miner sleeping together o the couch. Tabby opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly goes and takes his painting off the easel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came to get this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby follows Kelly across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the wedding's back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there in the yard. Tabby wraps her arms around herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's got cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabby looks at Kelly, pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a step towards him. He backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we all get what we deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks at Tabby for a second, then turns and walks a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly drives along an open stretch of road. He throws the painting out of the Jeep. He comes to a turn and takes it much too fast. The Jeep SKIDS, teeters on two wheels, and goes over the  embankment.

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF DITCH
dialogues.text: Steam trails up from the Jeep's radiator. The front end i completely smashed. Kelly bangs his fist against the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he calm himself, gets out, and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly rides an old bike up to the bike rack and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes in late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly! There you are. I was just  telling the class about our special  treat today. Mr. Ernswiler is going  to be giving the three first-period  history classes a little talk about  the Civil War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly closes his eyes. He had forgotten - or tried to for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all make our way in an orderly  fashion down to the auditorium, shall  we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class bolts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orderly, I said orderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Norman looks at Kelly pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what are we waiting for? I'm  so looking forward to hearing your  views.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sits in a chair on the stage next to Mr. Norman. A scattering of KIDS sit out in the auditorium. Principal Holmstead stands at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those of you who haven't had the  chance to get to know Kelly, you  should know he has a very interesting  hobby. He takes part in reenactments  of World War II battles right here  in Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did that too. When I was seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scattered LAUGHTER. Kelly frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has an unusual first-hand knowledge  of history. We recently discovered  that this extends beyond World War  II to the Civil War, which he is  going to discuss with you today.  Kelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly rises to scant applause. He stands at the podium,  looking out at the crowd. He looks down and thinks. He looks back up. The silence  stretches. Kids start giggling. Finally he leans into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mr. Norman) Well, go after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his knees Kelly fumbles with his bike lock, getting ma and madder. Just as he's about to get it undone -- Lance appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, they re-assign you to the  bicycle brigade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly frowns at the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, cause I'm not. Remember  that little show I put on for the  school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Pants down? Doll? Hard  on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks up at Lance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that. I heard about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you hear me and Bridget aren't  going out anymore because of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been following the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance pushes Kelly away from his bike. Kelly falls back o his hands. He squints up at Lance and moves back towards his bike. Lance KICKS him back with his foot and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call me a homo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance KICKS him again. Kelly breathes hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a good time for me. Let's  re-schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time like the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance picks Kelly up and SLAPS him hard on the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you should probably get me to  write home to my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance PUNCHES Kelly and he reels. Then Kelly lunges for h and they fall to the ground. Kelly swings wildly but Lanc pins him down and gives him a few good ones. Then Mr. Norman comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Norman rushes over to them. Kelly scrambles up and rips at his bike lock, gets on his bike and rides away. Mr. Norman tries to take a panting Lance by the arm but L shakes him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly rides by his house and keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stops and looks up at the hospital but can't bring  himself to go in. He pedals on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sits on the loading dock of an abandoned factory. He watches the rusty barges glitter on the water. The win ruffles his sweaty hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart's not here. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door. Kelly wheels his bike down the drive He sees Bart sitting out by the pool with a couple of LAN BOYS. Bart sees Kelly and ignores him, laughs at something one the guys says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sits on the toilet, putting a bandage on a red scra down his arm. Eve appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Kelly. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks up at her. He's still got the cut eyebrow, wh has split back open, and some dried blood under his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Let me see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve comes over and tilts Kelly's head back to look at the cut. This is the first time she's touched him. She gets some antiseptic and ointment from under the sink along with Band-Aids and goes to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly lets her dab at his face. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going over to see dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly opens his eyes and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve puts a butterfly bandage across Kelly's eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you need to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly pulls his head away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point that's not an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not a good time, ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at Kelly sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't make me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice rising) It's not about you anymore --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? It was never about  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve rises to her feet. He's just sent her over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) What is wrong with you? When are you  going to stop blaming us, blaming  him? I'm sick of you being angry. I  want to be angry! They just took out  half of your father's stomach -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming and crying) You will not tell me what's enough.  You don't know about anything. All  you do is fight fake battles, in the  woods, on the playground. But this,  right here, us - this is the real  one, the only one worth anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man I love is dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's between you and him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at her son. Her face looks older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I made a mistake, if you felt  left out, I'm sorry. But I can only  deal with one thing at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve leaves. Kelly sits on the toilet, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines in through Kelly's window. He's laying in bed awake - has been for a while. He gets up and starts dressing slowly and deliberately. H puts on his best shirt and tie, sensing trouble when the  tie's too short. He pulls the suit out of his closet. The jacket doesn't fit. The sleeves don't even go down to his wrists. And he can hardly button the pants. He rips off the jacke He pulls everything out of his closet. Nothing there. He sits on the edge of his bed with his head in his hands He looks at his DRESS UNIFORM, hanging on the back of the closet in its dry-cleaning bag, right where his mom left He shakes his head. No, he couldn't do that. Then he sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's decorated for a wedding. Flower garlands trail up th banisters. GUESTS trickle in. Harrison, dressed in a suit with a boutonniere on his lap talks to an USHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sit any of Mathilda's sisters  next to me if you can help it. (to guest) Oh, hello. So nice to see you. Thank  you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart comes outside, also dressed as an usher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bart) Where's the priest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should be here any minute. Calm  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart walks down the steps and looks down the street. Kelly's walking towards him. IN HIS DRESS UNIFORM. Bart walks down the street to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks down. He can't meet Bart's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I uninvited you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart looks at Kelly and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you wearing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening) I can't let you come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you know why. Just go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly finally looks up at Bart and nods. A Town Car pulls up. Tabby gets out in her wedding dress. Has there even been more glorious woman? Will there ever be again? Her MAID OF HONOR leads her around to the side of the chu Kelly watches every step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks beautiful. Tell her - give  her my congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly walks off. Bart watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sits on the edge of the bed, head in hands. He sees the torn rabbit painting. After a minute, he pick it up and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Xiou-Xiou sits painting. Kelly enters with the rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Son of Eve. You startled me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma Ling. Can you fix this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She examines it and takes out a wet sponge. She wipes it  across the back of the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom made it for you. I can fix  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She works silently for a minute. Kelly watches her. She c a small piece of canvas to repair the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you come here to work on your  own stuff? Don't waste your time on  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never waste time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the painting over and gets out some paints to t it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. Everything can be mended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to tell me something,  aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. I could not tell you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve sleeps in a chair next to Abe, in bed sleeping. He lo pale but otherwise fine. Kelly stands in the doorway, still in his uniform. Abe comes to and sees him standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey dad. How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave me some stitches downstairs. (points to eyebrow) Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get punched?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple times, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feeling. Come on in and  watch some television. Don't worry,  this one's bolted to the wall. As  you can see, my reputation precedes  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly comes into the room and sits in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any battles this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy, busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe and Kelly look up at the television in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me this: how come no one ever  reenacts the Vietnam War?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be pretty depressing, wouldn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both continue to look up at the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus that, you'd have to have  protesters and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks dressed up like your mom and  me. People reenacting fleeing to  Canada, burning draft cards. I guess  that would ruin the spirit of the  thing, now wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could make it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe looks at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods. Eve wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were expecting some one else?

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Kelly and Eve get snacks from the vending machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve looks at Kelly, her face full of love and sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly nods slowly, taking this in. And it is finally too  much. He breaks down and cries. For the fear and the misplaced  rage, the fights and the stubbornness. But finally, relief. They walk back down the hall together. Eve reaches out an puts her hand on Kelly's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly rides his bike past the house and stops when he see the car packed up in front. Bart comes out with a box of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You going away already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The have this intensive summer  orientation thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart puts the box in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's optional, but dad thinks  it would be "a good way to meet  people."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He usually is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go Big Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly gives him a little ra-ra with one hand. Bart smiles Kelly's been doing his research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly lifts his foot up to the pedal of his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun. And get laid, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bart laughs a little and shakes his head. Kelly is gone. Harrison comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you'd let me bring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison checks the ties on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stocks shelves. There's a NEW GIRL working the register. Kelly sees SARAH come in. He follows her to the bakery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah picks some bagels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you don't work here anymore?  The Electro-shopper's getting rusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a summer internship at an  ad agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly moves around to her other side, closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah moves away. Once bitten twice shy and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to get a real  job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Probably when I figure  out something better to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be a stock boy your whole  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah walks to the front of the store. Kelly walks with h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I can. I mean, I probably won't,  but I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah turns to him at the checkout aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was good seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that presentation I told  you never to ask me about again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly stands in the front of the room, pointing to a batt plan with large arrows drawn on it. Charlie, Mr. Norman, Principal Holmstead, Eve and Sarah s among other OLD SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee arrayed his defenses over here.  Only this time, Grant was ready for  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly keeps talking. Many of the OLD SOLDIERS sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to old soldier 2) This is boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's see that slide of the  wife again.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINO TABLE
dialogues.text: Sarah, Kelly, and Eve play dominos with Charlie and Mr.  Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charlie) Remarkable, remarkable. And they  never knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real kicker was moving those  cutouts of tanks around. The thought  we had a whole regiment over there,  but it was just a couple of us and  those Hollywood props.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's amazing. Art playing a part  in war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're damned right. We practically  won the thing right there. (eyeing Sarah and Eve  with approval) Now this is more like it. Anyone  care to place a wager on the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly tries to gesture to Sarah "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think it would be more fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine having more fun that  I am now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Norman smiles at the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never been to a French  whorehouse, I take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve waits while Kelly and Sarah walk out to Sarah's car. Kelly helps Sarah into it and closes the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't understand how you did  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent my summers with my grandma  in the Catskills. She didn't give me  any spending money. (shrugs) So I played the bones for ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away. He watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot damn.
